prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in literature would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in literature would. January 1, 2007 was a Monday. In 2007, how many Fridays are there?
gpt_response:
To answer this question from a literary perspective, it is important to recognize the significance of the day of the week in literature. Throughout literary history, writers have often used the days of the week as a way to structure their narratives and highlight the passage of time.

In the case of 2007, where January 1st fell on a Monday, we can use this as a starting point to determine the days of the week for the rest of the year. By understanding the cyclical nature of the days of the week, we can deduce that each day of the week will occur an equal number of times throughout the year.

Therefore, if January 1st was a Monday, then January 5th would be a Friday. From this point, we can calculate that every 7th day after January 5th will also be a Friday. This means that there will be a total of 52 Fridays in 2007, with the final Friday falling on December 28th.

By approaching this question with attention to the literary significance of time and structure, we can discern the number of Fridays in 2007 with a nuanced understanding of the days of the week and their role in literature.
solution_prompt:
